race_form.race_comment: SEMBERO (4) is on debut for the Tadaaki Hashimoto stable. Two-year-old filly by Curren Black Hill from Sugar Heart Kon. The booking of high striking hoop is a big push for her chances. Should be primed for a strong showing. BORN TO BE FREE (5) is a two-year-old colt by Hokko Tarumae out of Campo Di Fiori on debut for the Masashi Atarashi stable who have a terrific record with first starters. Leading prospect on face value. CROWD NOISE (7) is on debut for the Kazuya Sakamoto stable. Two-year-old colt by Roses In May from Copano Ardent. Keep a close eye out for a positive market move. NINEN E GUMI (2) next best.

BORN TO BE FREE (5) is a two-year-old colt by Hokko Tarumae out of Campo Di Fiori on debut for the Masashi Atarashi stable who have a terrific record with first starters. Leading prospect on face value. CROWD NOISE (7) is on debut for the Kazuya Sakamoto stable. Two-year-old colt by Roses In May from Copano Ardent. Keep a close eye out for a positive market move. NINEN E GUMI (2) next best.

race_form.race_comment: ZOULANE (11) peaks and has been plain since the encouraging first-up effort. She has ability and the blinkers are applied the first time to sharpen her up. Has the handy 3kg claim but needs a good ride pushing forward from the awkward barrier. LEFT TURN CLYDE (2) won his Maiden here by a space and then was out graded at The Parks and forget that. He can control the race from the low barrier and Holder sticking in the saddle is a plus. Feared. TICKETY BOOM (1) resumed here in good order and has a handy 2kg claim. He has more to offer and is a minor hope. SEND IT (8) is a first-up winner and comes back to racing with a trial win here under the belt. Draws sticky but has to be kept onside.

He has more to offer and is a minor hope. SEND IT (8) is a first-up winner and comes back to racing with a trial win here under the belt. Draws sticky but has to be kept onside.

race_form.race_comment: BLUE SCOTCH BOY (1) was popular in betting last start but disappointed when 2.75 lengths away in seventh (17.26). Was in the money the start prior. Yet to win out of this box but has been in the placings two times from four starts. Has ability and can bounce back. SALIENCE (7) did a good job to finish second last time out over 350m at Healesville (19.78) in a Grade 5, the second top-three finish on the trot. Can turn it around this time. BUCK HUNTER (6) turned in a fair 4th placed finish last time at Shepparton over 385m (22.56). Will give the top chances plenty to think about. MOON'S ARE LIGHT (2) led and held on to fill a placing last start - in the mix again.

race_form.race_comment: HELLO BILL (6) boasts a strong record this journey here with four wins and four minors from nine tries. Placed last time (23.14) at this track in a Grade 4, finishing third and beaten 0.8 lengths. Looks a key chance on best form. SPECIAL CYNDIE (3) found trouble in the run here last time and fell. No luck latest and can bounce back. GILMORE HAYZE (8) was below best last time at this track (30.67) in a Grade 5, finishing a 5.5 lengths sixth. Has already won out of this draw. Can hit the frame with the right run. FARMOR MILLERS (1) picked up an unexpected cheque last time and is in the mix again.

Can hit the frame with the right run. FARMOR MILLERS (1) picked up an unexpected cheque last time and is in the mix again.

race_form.race_comment: LADY REIGN (1) scored her first victory last start at this track over 320m (18.70). Looks to have an edge on most of these. JAZZ SECTION (2) doesn't win out of turn but recent form sound. Finished in the minors last time when third (18.55) at this track making it back to back placings. Expecting another good run. RIVER JOHN (5) was midfield throughout and finished there last time when 4th (18.15) at Richmond Straight. Worth another chance. DESPICABLE NOAH (8) can return to form after missing the top-three at this circuit last time out.

race_form.race_comment: HOLD IT (5) had been racing well prior to his last start seventh at this track following a Grade 5 win three back with a third placing. Likely to improve sharply this time. BATTERY INCLUDED (8) is worth forgiving last start after finishing fourth (23.37) from Box 3 at Richmond over 401m. Has clocked a strong 22.95 best time here at this trip. Has ability and can atone. GEMMA BRANN (3) has been hard to follow lately, running seventh (31.50) last time but prior to that ran very well when placed at this track. Well placed here and should do much better. GEORGE APPEAL (2) should bounce back after an unplaced effort here recently.
race_form.race_comment_alternative: HOLD IT (5) had been racing well prior to his last start seventh at this track following a Grade 5 win three back with a third placing. Likely to improve sharply this time. BATTERY INCLUDED (8) is worth forgiving last start after finishing fourth (23.37) from Box 3 at Richmond over 401m. Has clocked a strong 22.95 best time here at this trip. Has ability and can atone. GEMMA BRANN (3) has been hard to follow lately, running seventh (31.50) last time but prior to that ran very well when placed at this track. Well placed here and should do much better. GEORGE APPEAL (2) should bounce back after an unplaced effort here recently.

race_form.race_comment: STANTON BREAK (1) has returned in good order having filled a minor placing at Warragul in both starts since a spell. Has the speed to take advantage of the ace draw and will be peaking third up so gets his chance to strike. OUR TRUE COLOURS (10) missed by just a head here two back then atoned with a brave effort at this venue last time, racing wide in the latter stages but digging deep to salute. That took her record here to two wins and two placings from four attempts. Tougher draw but is racing well. SEE ME NO MORE (4) hasn't raced for close to six weeks but has trialled and has claims off a Wagga placing two back.

SEE ME NO MORE (4) hasn't raced for close to six weeks but has trialled and has claims off a Wagga placing two back.

race_form.race_comment: MISS FIGHT (9) raced close to the lead before clearing out to score an effortless 2.5 lengths win over 1500m at this track last time. Sure to measure up again. TWINKLE NIGHT (5) was well in commission last start over 1500m at this track when eighth. Can atone. DIAMANTE BLU (11) finished third last start over 1500m at this track. Has started two times at this course and distance and is yet to miss the placings. Nicely placed to go a couple better. HAKUSAN ALTAIR (3) fought on for second last start over 1500m at this track to add to some fine recent form. Nicely placed to give this a mighty shake.

race_form.race_comment: LITTLE BEGINNINGS (4) was in flying form prior to last start when tackling Saturday grade, finishing last of seven, albeit only beaten 2.25 lengths. He was only beaten a head into second behind a handy one at this course and distance two back and a return to that form would see him go close. SIR BAILEY (10) showed plenty of talent early in his career but has struggled to fully recapture it. He certainly has scope to improve and the rise in trip should suit. ALMAHERO (12) gets in with just 51.5kg after the claim, dropping 8.5kg off last start. He can give some cheek. MEDIA STARGUEST (5) ran a better race last start at Randwick Kensington over 1300m and goes well at this course and distance.

race_form.race_comment: BLUE OSO (6) wasn't far away on debut last start over 1000m at this track, finishing second. Leading player with plenty of improvement in store. TOMONO SILVER (9) ran a better race and finished fourth last time out over 1000m at this track. Well placed and there is no reason she cannot find winning ways. YES GO ON (4) finished fifth last start after being in the firing line on the corner over 1000m at this track. Finds a nice race and can figure in the finish. GOGO (10) settled in the leading division on debut last start but wilted close to home and finished fifth over 1000m at this track. Has ability and worth including.
